required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Skin Tone Preferences and Their Influence on Skin Care Behaviors
clinical_study.official_title: Skin Tone Preferences and Their Influence on Skin Care Behaviors

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to classify participants by actual skin tone and skin tone preference and identify whether an association exists between these skin tone preferences and knowledge of skin care recommendations, attitudes towards healthy skin care, or skin care behaviors.

detailed_description.textblock: This study seeks to examine if there is a difference between ideal and actual skin tone among minority populations. In addition, we hope to assess whether various demographic factors as well as disparity between ideal and actual skin tone effect skin protective behaviors (i.e. sun screen use, dermatologist appointments, skin self-exams) or skin destructive behaviors (i.e. outdoor tanning, tanning salon use, use of skin lightening products) in minority populations.

primary_outcome.measure: Frequency of skin tone differences between ideal and actual
primary_outcome.description: The frequency at which research participants indicate ideal skin tone differences versus actual will be assessed in the questionnaire. The unit of measure will be a numerical value, number of participants.

intervention.description: Participants will complete a survey online

study_pop.textblock: Adult self-identified minorities (African, Asian, Hispanic/Latino, American Indian, Alaskan native, etc.)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects age 18 years old or older
- Self-identified members of a minority (African, Asian, Hispanic/Latino, American Indian, Alaskan native, etc.) population
- Subjects who are capable of completing an online, English survey
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects age 17 years old or younger
- Subjects not self-identified members of a minority (African, Asian, Hispanic/Latino, American Indian, Alaskan native, etc.) population
- Subjects who are incapable of completing an online, English survey

facility.name: Northwestern University Feinberg School of Medicine Department of Dermatology
